result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J Fleming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Austin J Fleming
parties.address: 522 N. 8th Avenue, Apt. D, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time work, school or combination of the two. Complete high school or obtain a GED/HSED.

To commit no further law violations during the period of the agreement.  No contact with J.D. or anyone involved in illegal drug use or distribution. To consume no alcoholic beverages or controlled substances. No entry into bars or taverns. Not to possess drug paraphernalia.

Complete an Alcohol and/or Other Drug Abuse (AODA) Assessment with a certified Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor, at an appropriate counseling or treatment center and willingly cooperate in any recommended counseling or treatment. The defendant must ensure that the counselor sends the written results of said assessment to the District Attorney's Office on or before 8/01/16. If counseling is recommended, the defendant must ensure that the counselor sends written documentation of the defendant's attendance and compliance with any recommendation to the District Attorney's Office by 1/01/17.

Take any/all medications prescribed by a licensed physician. Compy with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete any term of probation ordered as a part of this case.   Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall perform an additional 20 hours of uncompensated community service and provide proof to the DA's office at least 30 days before the expiration of the agreement.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Defendant to pay financial obligations on Cts. 2 & 3 as part of probation on Ct. 1.     If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To repay $175 buy money to the Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  No contact with victims or co-defendant J.D.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: To perform 60 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation apply to both counts.

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs. To reimburse the Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  No contact direct or indirect with J.D.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.
30 days STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from Dept. of Corrections. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

records.addlTxt: Court reviews events in file. reviews revocation order and warrant re: Cts. 2 & 3.  State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense give joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Austin J Fleming in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Austin J Fleming in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to revoke DAGPA on Ct. 1. Defense agrees to vacate DAGPA. Court accepts defendants no contest, finds him guilty of Ct. 1.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense give joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Austin J Fleming in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Austin J Fleming in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions counsel where matter is at. Atty Gerbers received revocation packet, would like some time to review case materials with defendant. Atty Gerbers would like to resolve matter before the end of the year. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2016 at 09:45 am.
to vacate DAGPA

for DNA Sample

Defendant Austin J Fleming in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that matter is resolved. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas on Counts 2 and 3, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3. Court finds basis to accept plea on Count 1, withholds acceptance of plea on Count 1, reviews conditions contained with DAGPA, approves DAGPA. Counts 4, 5 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond continues as is.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 24, 2019 at 11:45 am.
State's Discovery Demand
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Austin J Fleming in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Austin J Fleming in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Fagundes asks court to set a status in this matter. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Austin J Fleming in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, explains why defendants petition for appoint of counsel request was denied. Court will to give defendant time to get the money together to retain an atty. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Denied-court finds the def. is not indigent.
